alert.note: Alert for Daviess; Henderson (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Paducah (Southern Illinois and Indiana, Southeastern Missouri and Western Kentucky)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 29 at 11:30AM EST until February 06 at 4:36AM EST by NWS Paducah
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Kentucky...Indiana...Illinois... Ohio River at Newburgh Dam, Mount Vernon, J.T. Myers Dam and Shawneetown. .Above normal rainfall this month continues to cause significant rises on the Ohio River. The river will rise above flood stage at Newburgh and Shawneetown tonight, and at Mount Vernon and J.T. Myers Wednesday morning. The river will crest at these points Friday night into Saturday morning. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING TO TUESDAY, FEBRUARY 06... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Ohio River at Newburgh Dam. * WHEN...From this evening to Tuesday, February 06. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:00 AM CST Monday the stage was 36.8 feet. - Bankfull stage is 35.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late this evening to a crest of 41.4 feet Saturday evening. It will then fall below flood stage Monday, February 05. - Flood stage is 38.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/pah.
